Normally, you wouldn't work at the zoo. However, fate decided to drop into your life. After a fight with your parents about your lack of religious beliefs, you were promptly excommunicated and kicked out of your home. While your old enough to fend for yourself, you still have no job and no roof over your head. So It seemed as chance that you noticed a certain flyer hanging on the message board of the employment office. The flyer described an opening at the local zoo as a "research subject". Applicants who were accepted would receive excellent pay and on-site housing for their cooperation in different research projects. There was only one requirement that had to be met for an application to be accepted. According to the flyer, the research being conducted is of a secretive nature, and only applicants without social ties were to be accepted. Lucky for you. The last note on the flyer mentions that anyone meeting the job criteria could come to the research building on the zoo grounds to apply.

With haste you proceed to the zoo's research building. Upon entering the facility, you notice a friendly looking secretary looking your direction.

"You must be here for the research study." She says with a smile.

You nod.

"Right this way please." Says the secretary, as she directs you toward what appears to be an examination room, similar to that of a clinic.

She sits you on an examination table, and retrieves an item from the counter to your left.

"Can I get you to fill out this health form for me?" She says, handing you a clipboard.
"The doctor will be meeting with you in a few minutes." With that, the secretary turns and leaves.

How do you proceed from here?

You begin to look over the form you were given. It's rather basic, requiring only general health information. Too bad that nice secretary didn't give you a pen to fill out the form with. Fortunately for you, the door opens and a middle aged lab-coated figure steps inside. This must be the doctor.

"Greetings. Name's Dr Norm. You must be (your name here). I understand you came in to apply for the research subject, am I correct"?

You nod, and briefly describe your situation to the doctor. He listens as you describe your recent turn of events. When you finish, the doctor begins to speak once more.

"Well (your name here), I'm glad you came in today. The research me and my team are working on is incredibly valuable, but we have had a rough time finding anyone meeting our qualifications. Since we are in a huge rush to continue our research, I'm going to make you a very generous offer. Since your situation makes you ideal for this study, I'm willing to skip all of the unnecessary paperwork and such and get you started immediantly. But due to the nature of the study I am conducting, once you enter my labratory, you will be unable to leave until the testing is complete. I can assure you, however, that the study is completely safe. What do you say (your name here), will you join my study?
